newsitem.title: USA: US corp bond mart calm,players get set for holiday.
newsitem.headline: US corp bond mart calm,players get set for holiday.

text.p: A quiet day is on tap for the corporate bond primary market as players head out early during a shortened session ahead of the U.S. Memorial Day holiday.
"It's going to be a real snoozer today," said one high-grade syndicate source. "There are very few players around so if you don't see anything in the first hour get done you're not going to see it."

PSA The Bond Market Trade Association has recommended an early 1400 EDT/1800 GMT close for the U.S. Treasury and fixed-income markets. On Monday, U.S. financial markets will remain closed in observance of the Memorial Day holiday.
On Thursday, about $1.0 billion in high-yield debt was sold in the primary market with still more business on tap for the coming weeks, dealers said.
So far on Friday, Brooks Fiber Properties BFPT.O), a full service provider of local telecommunications services, set $250 million in 10-year 144A notes at +327 over U.S. Treasuries.
The deal was increased from an initial size of $200 million and was jointly underwritten by Salomon Brothers and Merrill Lynch & Co, dealers said.

Also, Magnum Hunter Resources sold $140 million in 10-year 144A senior notes to yield 10 percent via BT Securities, sources said. The deal was increased from an original size of $125 million, they addes.

Looking ahead, several more high-yield issues are slated to come to market, one of which is Intercel Inc. The firm is expected to issue $300 million in 10-year 144A senior notes via Morgan Stanley, sources said.
Among other upcoming offerings, Lehman Brothers is expected to underwrite the following two new capital securities deals, sources said.
Elsewhere, the calendar for high-grade issues is building with several offerings slated to come to market next week, syndicate sources said.

Among upcoming debt offerings Tandy Corp, a Fort Worth, Texas-based retailer of consumer electronics and computers, is expected to tap the market with a $200 million 10-year debt issue via Bear Stearns & Co, sources said.

Briggs & Stratton Corp, a maker of engines for lawn and garden equipment, is also expected to sell $100 million in 10-year debt and $75 million in five-year debt via Credit Suisse First Boston, sources said.

Another $600 million three-part debt offering from Hartford Life is expected to hit the market next week, sources said. The deal is expected to include seven-year, 10-year and 30-year maturities, they said.
In the government market, the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond is trading up 1/32 at 95-15/32 to yield 6.99 percent.
